Title: Building Codes
CDP definition: Building Codes
Explainer for action card: "Building Codes and Standards" entail the formulation and enforcement of regulations guiding the construction of environmentally responsible buildings. By implementing stringent codes, cities promote energy efficiency, reduce carbon emissions, and enhance resilience to climate change, fostering sustainable urban development.

Title: Building Codes
CDP definition: Building Codes
Explainer for action card: "Building Codes and Standards, Residential Buildings" entail the formulation and enforcement of regulations guiding the construction of environmentally responsible buildings. By implementing stringent codes, cities promote energy efficiency, reduce carbon emissions, and enhance resilience to climate change, fostering sustainable urban development.

Title: Building Codes
CDP definition: Building Codes
Explainer for action card: "Building Codes and Standards, Commercial Buildings" entail the formulation and enforcement of regulations guiding the construction of environmentally responsible buildings. By implementing stringent codes, cities promote energy efficiency, reduce carbon emissions, and enhance resilience to climate change, fostering sustainable urban development.

Title: Building Codes
CDP definition: Building Codes
Explainer for action card: "Building Codes and Standards, Institutional Buildings" entail the formulation and enforcement of regulations guiding the construction of environmentally responsible buildings. By implementing stringent codes, cities promote energy efficiency, reduce carbon emissions, and enhance resilience to climate change, fostering sustainable urban development.

Title: Building Codes
CDP definition: Building Codes
Explainer for action card: "Building Codes and Standards, Industrial Buildings" entail the formulation and enforcement of regulations guiding the construction of environmentally responsible buildings. By implementing stringent codes, cities promote energy efficiency, reduce carbon emissions, and enhance resilience to climate change, fostering sustainable urban development.

Title: Retrofit Measures
CDP definition: Energy efficiency/ retrofit measures addressing existing commercial, residential and/or municipal buildings
Explainer for action card: "Retrofit Measures" encompass targeted interventions to enhance the environmental performance of existing buildings, promoting energy efficiency and sustainability. This initiative focuses on upgrading structures to reduce emissions and contribute to the city's commitment to climate change mitigation.

Title: Retrofit Measures
CDP definition: Energy efficiency/ retrofit measures addressing existing commercial, residential and/or municipal buildings
Explainer for action card: "Retrofit Measures, Residential buildings" encompass targeted interventions to enhance the environmental performance of existing buildings, promoting energy efficiency and sustainability. This initiative focuses on upgrading structures to reduce emissions and contribute to the city's commitment to climate change mitigation.

Title: Retrofit Measures
CDP definition: Energy efficiency/ retrofit measures addressing existing commercial, residential and/or municipal buildings
Explainer for action card: "Retrofit Measures, Commercial buildings" encompass targeted interventions to enhance the environmental performance of existing buildings, promoting energy efficiency and sustainability. This initiative focuses on upgrading structures to reduce emissions and contribute to the city's commitment to climate change mitigation.

Title: New Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra-high-efficiency standards for new buildings
Explainer for action card: "New Building Standards" set guidelines for environmentally responsible construction, ensuring that new structures adhere to energy-efficient practices, thereby reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainable urban development.

Title: New Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra-high-efficiency standards for new buildings
Explainer for action card: "New Building Standards, Residential buildings" set guidelines for environmentally responsible construction, ensuring that new structures adhere to energy-efficient practices, thereby reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainable urban development.

Title: New Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra-high-efficiency standards for new buildings
Explainer for action card: "New Building Standards, Commercial buildings" set guidelines for environmentally responsible construction, ensuring that new structures adhere to energy-efficient practices, thereby reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainable urban development.

Title: New Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra-high-efficiency standards for new buildings
Explainer for action card: "New Building Standards, Institutional buidlings" set guidelines for environmentally responsible construction, ensuring that new structures adhere to energy-efficient practices, thereby reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainable urban development.

Title: New Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra-high-efficiency standards for new buildings
Explainer for action card: "New Building Standards, Industrial" set guidelines for environmentally responsible construction, ensuring that new structures adhere to energy-efficient practices, thereby reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainable urban development.

Title: Existing Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra high-efficiency standards for existing buildings
Explainer for action card: "Existing Building Standards" involve interventions to improve the environmental performance of current structures, aiming to boost energy efficiency, decrease emissions, and enhance overall sustainability within a city.

Title: Existing Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra high-efficiency standards for existing buildings
Explainer for action card: "Existing Building Standards, Residential buildings" involve interventions to improve the environmental performance of current structures, aiming to boost energy efficiency, decrease emissions, and enhance overall sustainability within a city.

Title: Existing Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra high-efficiency standards for existing buildings
Explainer for action card: "Existing Building Standards, Commercial buildings" involve interventions to improve the environmental performance of current structures, aiming to boost energy efficiency, decrease emissions, and enhance overall sustainability within a city.

Title: Existing Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra high-efficiency standards for existing buildings
Explainer for action card: "Existing Building Standards, Institutional buildings" involve interventions to improve the environmental performance of current structures, aiming to boost energy efficiency, decrease emissions, and enhance overall sustainability within a city.

Title: Existing Building Standards
CDP definition: Requirements which incentivize net zero carbon, Passivhaus or other ultra high-efficiency standards for existing buildings
Explainer for action card: "Existing Building Standards, Industrial buildings" involve interventions to improve the environmental performance of current structures, aiming to boost energy efficiency, decrease emissions, and enhance overall sustainability within a city.

Title: Municipal Buildings
CDP definition: Action to advance net zero carbon municipal buildings
Explainer for action card: "Municipal Buildings" focus on implementing eco-friendly practices and standards in government-owned structures, showcasing the city's commitment to sustainability while serving as a model for environmentally responsible construction.

Title: On-Site Renewables
CDP definition: On-site renewable energy generation

Title: Heat Networks
CDP definition: Domestic and/or commercial heat network
Explainer for action card: "Heat Networks" involve the development of efficient systems for distributing heat, promoting energy conservation and reducing carbon footprints in urban areas. This initiative aims to enhance the sustainability of heating infrastructure within the city.

Title: Clean heating/cooling
CDP definition: Increase use of clean energy sources for heating and cooling buildings
Explainer for action card: "Increase use of clean energy sources for heating and cooling buildings" emphasizes the transition to renewable and low-carbon energy systems in the heating and cooling sectors of urban infrastructure. By promoting the adoption of sustainable technologies such as solar, geothermal, or district energy systems, cities aim to reduce carbon emissions, enhance energy efficiency, and create a more environmentally friendly approach to building climate control.

Title: Bus Emissions
CDP definition: Improve fuel economy and reduce CO2 emissions from bus and/or light rail
Explainer for action card: "Bus Emissions" mitigation focuses on reducing the environmental impact of bus fleets. Implementing cleaner technologies and fuels helps minimize emissions, contributing to improved air quality and sustainable urban transportation.

Title: Ferry Emissions
CDP definition: Improve fuel economy and reduce CO2 emissions from ferries
Explainer for action card: "Ferry Emissions" reduction strategies aim to decrease the environmental footprint of water-based transportation. Implementing cleaner fuels and emission control technologies enhances the sustainability of ferry operations, preserving marine ecosystems.

Title: Truck Emissions
CDP definition: Improve fuel economy and reduce CO2 emissions from trucks
Explainer for action card: "Truck Emissions" mitigation involves adopting cleaner fuels and technologies to reduce the environmental impact of freight transportation. This initiative aims to decrease air pollution, promote sustainability, and improve the overall efficiency of urban logistics.

Title: Vehicle Emissions
CDP definition: Improve fuel economy and reduce CO2 emissions from motorized vehicles
Explainer for action card: "Vehicle Emissions" reduction strategies focus on minimizing the environmental impact of all types of vehicles. Implementing cleaner technologies and promoting alternative fuels contribute to lower emissions, fostering sustainable and eco-friendly transportation.

Title: Rail Improvements
CDP definition: Improve rail, metro, and tram infrastructure, services and operations
Explainer for action card: "Rail Improvements" involve enhancing the efficiency and sustainability of railway systems. By investing in modernization and eco-friendly practices, cities aim to promote rail as a low-emission and energy-efficient mode of transportation.

Title: Zero Emission Buses
CDP definition: Procurement of zero emissions buses
Explainer for action card: "Zero Emission Buses" initiatives focus on integrating electric or other zero-emission technologies into public transportation fleets. This strategy aims to eliminate traditional bus emissions, contributing to cleaner air and a more sustainable urban transit system.

Title: EV Fleet
CDP definition: Procurement of electric vehicles for government fleet
Explainer for action card: "EV Fleet" initiatives involve transitioning municipal vehicle fleets to electric vehicles (EVs). By embracing electric transportation, cities reduce emissions, lower air pollution, and contribute to the overall adoption of sustainable and eco-friendly mobility solutions.

Title: EV Charging
CDP definition: Electric vehicle charging points and infrastructure

Title: Smart Transit
CDP definition: Smart public transport
Explainer for action card: "Smart Transit" involves the integration of advanced technologies and data-driven solutions to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of public transportation systems. By incorporating smart technologies, cities aim to optimize transit routes, improve service reliability, and provide a more seamless and sustainable commuting experience for residents.

Title: Transit Access
CDP definition: Improve walking, cycling and integrated transit access
Explainer for action card: "Transit Access" initiatives focus on improving walking, cycling, and integrated transit access to create a more interconnected and sustainable urban transportation network. This involves enhancing infrastructure and promoting multi-modal options to reduce reliance on individual vehicles.

Title: 15/30-Minute Areas
CDP definition: Development of 15/30-minute neighborhoods (complete neighborhoods)
Explainer for action card: "15/30-Minute Areas" refer to the development of complete neighborhoods where essential services, amenities, and public transport are easily accessible within a 15 or 30-minute walk or bike ride. This urban planning approach promotes sustainability by reducing the need for long-distance travel and fostering community resilience.

Title: Material Bans
CDP definition: Bans or restrictions on single use or non-recyclable materials
Explainer for action card: "Material Bans" involve imposing restrictions on single-use or non-recyclable materials to reduce environmental impact. By prohibiting certain materials, cities aim to promote the use of sustainable alternatives, contributing to waste reduction and overall environmental conservation.

Title: Waste Efficiency
CDP definition: Improve the efficiency of waste collection
Explainer for action card: "Waste Efficiency" initiatives aim to improve the efficiency of waste collection processes, reducing resource consumption and minimizing environmental impact. This includes optimizing waste management systems to enhance energy efficiency and promote sustainable waste disposal practices.

Title: Landfill Management
CDP definition: Landfill management
Explainer for action card: "Landfill Management" strategies focus on responsible and sustainable landfill practices to minimize environmental degradation. By adopting effective management techniques, cities aim to reduce the ecological footprint associated with landfill sites and encourage waste reduction.

Title: Source Separation
CDP definition: Adopt source separation policies (e.g., collection for dry recyclables, organic compostable waste, etc.)
Explainer for action card: "Source Separation" policies involve the adoption of practices like separate collection for dry recyclables and organic compostable waste. By encouraging residents to sort their waste at the source, cities promote recycling, reduce contamination, and contribute to overall waste management efficiency.

Title: Sanitary Landfills
CDP definition: Ensuring residual waste is disposed of adequately (in at least an engineered sanitary landfill)
Explainer for action card: "Sanitary Landfills" ensure proper disposal of residual waste in engineered facilities, minimizing environmental impact. This mitigation strategy involves utilizing advanced technological solutions to manage waste effectively, promoting sustainable waste disposal practices within a city.

Title: Gas Management
CDP definition: Sanitary landfill with leachate capture and landfill gas management system
Explainer for action card: "Gas Management" in sanitary landfills involves capturing leachate and managing landfill gas to mitigate environmental hazards. Implementing effective gas management systems contributes to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and enhances overall waste management sustainability.

Title: Volume-Based Collection
CDP definition: Volume based waste collection policy (e.g., fees or incentives)
Explainer for action card: "Volume-Based Collection" policies incentivize waste reduction by implementing fees or incentives based on the amount of waste generated. This approach encourages residents to minimize waste production, contributing to overall waste reduction goals.

Title: Waste Collection
CDP definition: City is achieving universal waste collection
Explainer for action card: "Waste Collection" initiatives focus on achieving universal waste collection, ensuring that all residents have access to proper waste disposal services. This contributes to a cleaner and healthier urban environment while promoting sustainable waste management practices.

Title: Biodiversity Expansion
CDP definition: Green space and/ or biodiversity preservation and expansion
Explainer for action card: "Biodiversity Expansion" initiatives aim to preserve and expand green spaces, promoting biodiversity within urban areas. By preserving natural habitats, cities enhance ecosystem services and create resilient environments that support diverse flora and fauna.

Title: Low-Carbon Energy
CDP definition: Low or zero carbon energy supply generation
Explainer for action card: "Low-Carbon Energy" involves the generation of energy with low or zero carbon emissions. This mitigation strategy focuses on using eco-friendly energy sources to reduce the environmental impact associated with the generation of grid-supplied energy.

Title: Photovoltaic
CDP definition: Low or zero carbon energy supply generation

Title: Wind
CDP definition: Low or zero carbon energy supply generation

Title: Coastal Protection
CDP definition: Sea walls and coastal protection structures
Explainer for action card: "Coastal Protection" strategies include the construction of sea walls and protective structures to mitigate the impact of rising sea levels and coastal erosion. This adaptation measure enhances the resilience of coastal areas and protects communities from the impacts of climate change.

Title: Water Storage
CDP definition: Water storage and pump storage
Explainer for action card: "Water Storage" and pump storage solutions enhance water resource management, ensuring availability during periods of scarcity. This adaptation strategy contributes to sustainable water use and resilience to climate-related challenges.

Title: Improved Drainage
CDP definition: Improved drainage
Explainer for action card: "Improved Drainage" involves eco-engineering solutions to enhance drainage systems, mitigating the risk of flooding. This adaptation measure aims to improve urban resilience by minimizing the impact of extreme weather events.

Title: Cyclone Shelters
CDP definition: Flood and cyclone shelters
Explainer for action card: "Cyclone Shelters" provide safe havens during flood and cyclone events, enhancing community resilience. This eco-engineering adaptation ensures the safety of residents in vulnerable areas during extreme weather conditions.

Title: White Roofs
CDP definition: White roofs
Explainer for action card: "White Roofs" utilize eco-engineering by adopting reflective roofing materials to reduce heat absorption. This adaptation strategy helps mitigate the urban heat island effect, contributing to more sustainable and climate-resilient buildings.
Notes VM: Somewhat positive in energy, as white roofs can lower the demand for cooling

Title: Public Shading
CDP definition: Shading in public spaces
Explainer for action card: "Public Shading" involves the implementation of shade structures in public spaces, contributing to eco-engineering efforts. This adaptation measure enhances outdoor comfort, reduces heat stress, and promotes sustainable urban design.

Title: Cool Pavement
CDP definition: Cool pavement
Explainer for action card: "Cool Pavement" initiatives involve the use of reflective materials to reduce pavement heat absorption. This adaptation strategy contributes to mitigating heat-related challenges, enhancing urban resilience in the context of heating and cooling.

Title: Water Savings
CDP definition: Water saving technologies (including rainwater harvesting)
Explainer for action card: "Water Savings" technologies, including rainwater harvesting, aim to conserve water resources. This adaptation measure involves technological actions to enhance eco-engineering efforts, ensuring sustainable water use in the face of changing climate conditions.
Notes VM: Somehwat positive in energy, as the recycling/savings categories can help reduce the amount of energy used for water collecting

Title: Water Recycling
CDP definition: Water recycling/reclamation
Explainer for action card: "Water Recycling" or reclamation involves technological actions to treat and reuse water resources. This adaptation measure contributes to water resource sustainability and resilience, particularly in the context of changing climate patterns.
Notes VM: Somehwat positive in energy, as the recycling/savings categories can help reduce the amount of energy used for water collecting

Title: Green Infrastructure
CDP definition: Green infrastructure

Title: Watershed Preservation
CDP definition: Watershed preservation
Explainer for action card: "Watershed Preservation" involves the protection and conservation of natural watershed areas to safeguard water quality, biodiversity, and ecosystem services. This initiative aims to ensure sustainable water management and resilience to the impacts of climate change.

Title: Food Redistribution
CDP definition: Food donation and redistribution of food surplus
Explainer for action card: "Food Redistribution" programs focus on minimizing food waste by redirecting surplus food to those in need. This initiative contributes to sustainable food systems, reduces environmental impact, and addresses issues of food insecurity within the community.

Title: Preparedness
CDP definition: Public preparedness (including exercises/drills)
Explainer for action card: "Preparedness" refers to comprehensive planning and readiness measures to anticipate and respond to the impacts of climate-related events. This strategy ensures that communities are equipped to handle emergencies and enhance overall resilience

Title: Early Warning
CDP definition: Early warning and response systems
Explainer for action card: "Early Warning" systems involve the timely detection and communication of potential climate-related hazards, enabling proactive responses to mitigate risks. This initiative enhances community preparedness and reduces the impact of adverse events.

Title: Managed Retreat
CDP definition: Managed retreat/planned relocation
Explainer for action card: "Managed Retreat" strategies involve planned relocation away from high-risk areas vulnerable to climate change impacts. This adaptation measure aims to protect communities from sea-level rise, flooding, and other environmental risks.

Title: Non-Potable Water
CDP definition: Use of non-potable water
Explainer for action card: "Non-Potable Water" initiatives involve the use of treated or untreated water for non-drinking purposes such as irrigation, industrial processes, or flushing. This water conservation strategy reduces the demand on potable water sources and promotes sustainable water management.

Title: Water Tariffs
CDP definition: Water tariffs
Explainer for action card: "Water Tariffs" involve pricing structures for water use, encouraging conservation and efficient use of water resources. This initiative aims to promote responsible water consumption and contribute to sustainable water management.

Title: Local Food Support
CDP definition: Financial support to expand local food production (including urban agriculture programs, community gardens, etc.)
Explainer for action card: "Local Food Support" programs promote the production and consumption of locally sourced foods. This initiative enhances food security, reduces the carbon footprint associated with food transportation, and supports local agricultural economies.

Title: Market Access
CDP definition: Financial support to improve market access for local food producers
Explainer for action card: "Market Access" initiatives aim to remove barriers that hinder farmers' access to markets, promoting equitable opportunities for agricultural producers. This strategy enhances food security, fosters economic development, and supports sustainable food systems.

Title: Food Access Laws
CDP definition: Land zoning laws to increase local food access (including grocery stores, farmers markets, community gardens, etc.)
Explainer for action card: "Food Access Laws" involve legislation and policies that ensure equitable access to healthy and affordable food options. This initiative addresses food justice issues and promotes community well-being through improved food access.

Title: Efficiency Rules
CDP definition: Water efficiency regulations or standards
Explainer for action card: "Efficiency Rules" encompass regulations and standards aimed at improving resource use and reducing waste in various sectors. This initiative contributes to overall resource efficiency, environmental sustainability, and climate mitigation.

Title: Air Quality
CDP definition: Air quality initiatives
Explainer for action card: "Air Quality" initiatives focus on monitoring, regulating, and improving air quality to mitigate the impact of pollution on public health and the environment. This strategy contributes to creating healthier urban environments and addressing climate-related health risks.

Title: Dietary Shift Promotion
CDP definition: Public policies to encourage citizen dietary shift to sustainable, healthy diets (including incentivizing purchase of low-carbon foods, plant-based or alternative proteins)
Explainer for action card: "Dietary Shift Promotion" involves campaigns and policies to encourage healthier and more sustainable dietary choices. This initiative aims to reduce the environmental impact of food systems and promote climate-friendly eating habits.

Title: Food Procurement
CDP definition: Municipal/jurisdictional food procurement policies that align with guidelines for sustainable, healthy diets (including school procurement, etc.)
Explainer for action card: "Food Procurement" strategies involve sourcing food for public institutions and services from sustainable and local producers. This initiative supports sustainable agriculture, reduces the carbon footprint of food supply chains, and promotes responsible consumption.

Title: City is implementing city-wide speed restrictions and a programme of physichal measures to tackle road danger
Explainer for action card: "City-wide Speed Restrictions and Road Danger Measures" include the implementation of speed limits and physical measures to enhance road safety. This program aims to reduce traffic-related hazards, promote sustainable transportation, and improve overall urban safety.

Title: Sustainable Cooking
CDP definition: City is implementing or incentivising a phase out of fossil fuel or solid fuel technologies for heating and cooking
Explainer for action card: "Sustainable Cooking" initiatives encourage environmentally friendly cooking practices, including the use of energy-efficient appliances and sustainable cooking methods. This strategy promotes resource conservation and contributes to overall sustainability in food preparation.
